Description: A glazed composition model of a vase on a stand: the stand narrows slightly towards the top edge, where there is a pronounced lip, in imitation of the form of pot-stands in use at the period. The green glaze has largely decayed to dull white, although otherwise the object is in good condition.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Temple of Osiris-Khentimentu (Abydos), Excavator's mark M.190
Curator's comments: For similar objects, see W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' II (London, 1902-4), pl.XXI, 236, 244; ). J. E. Quibell & F. W. Green, 'Hierakonpolis' I (London, 1989), pl.XX, 11; B. Adams, 'Ancient Hierakonpolis' (Warminster, 1974), 33, no. 163 and pl.31; H. W. Müller, 'Ägyptische Kunstwerke, Kleinfunde und Glas in der Sammlung E. & M. Kofler-Truniger' (Berlin, 1964), A 64, a-g. See also G. Dreyer, 'Mitteilungen der Deutschen Archäologischen Instituts Abteilung Kairo' 32 (Wiesbaden, 1976), 86, VII (c). Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' II (London, 1902-4), pl. XI, 244.
